# Community Assessment and Parole Supervision (CAPS) Tender Notice

**Summary:**
Correctional Service Canada (CSC) invites interested suppliers to submit a bid for the provision of Community Assessment and Parole Supervision (CAPS) services in the Saint John area, New Brunswick. The successful bidder will assist offenders in reintegrating into the community as law-abiding citizens through programs, plans, and supervision in institutions and in the community.

**Key Requirements:**
The government has issued this tender to provide the following services:

* Assist offenders in reintegrating into the community as law-abiding citizens through programs, plans, and supervision in institutions and in the community.
* Provide case management services, including supervision, risk assessment, urinalysis collection, and report writing for offenders on conditional release and Long-Term Supervision Order (LTSO).
* Deliverables include Case Management reports to the Technical Authority and maintenance of clear, legible, and detailed Casework Records.

**Conditions:**
The successful bidder must:

* Provide services in the official language of the offender's choice (English or French).
* Submit reports and deliverables in accordance with CSC policies and procedures.
* Maintain confidentiality and handle sensitive information with discretion.

**Opportunity Information:**
* **Notice Period:** 2024-04-18 to 2024-05-20.
* **Tender Closing Date:** 2024-05-20T13:00:00.
* **Expected Contract Start Date:** 2024-09-01.
* **Duration:** 2024-09-01 to 2028-03-31.

**Inquiries:**
To obtain more information, please contact the Contracting Authority, Jolaine Amos, at 506-269-3787 or jolaine.amos@csc-scc.gc.ca.

**Procedure:**
Bidders should submit their application and bid in accordance with the instructions outlined in the tender notice and accompanying documents. The government reserves the right to negotiate with suppliers on any procurement. The Crown also reserves the right to negotiate with suppliers on any procurement.

Note to bidders: Bidders can obtain the complete statement of work and evaluation criteria by downloading the solicitation document and associated documents from the Canada buys/tender opportunities website. After contract award, bidders may request a debriefing on the results of the bid solicitation process. Bidders should make the request to the Contracting Authority within fifteen (15) working days of receipt of the results of the bid
